source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
candidate: Scientists want to know how our genes affect the brain and language. A gene is a small part of DNA that gives our body instructions. Did some genes change and help people speak? Scientists found a change in one gene that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This change seems connected to speaking and to how the brain controls the mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not have this change. It is too early to know how much genes affect language. Maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
candidate: There are more questions when we look at how genes affect the brain and the development of language. Did some genes change and give humans the ability to use language? Researchers found a change in a gene that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. It seems linked to speaking and to how our brains move our mouths and faces. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not have this change. It is still too early to know how much genes shape language, but one day we might find the answers in our DNA.

Julie lives with her family in a smart home that she designed herself.

source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
candidate: NASA is now working to make a list of some smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 metres wide or more. There may be about 25,000 asteroids this size. NASA has records for about 8,000. About 17,000 are not on the list yet. In 2013, one asteroid that was 19 metres wide exploded over the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. It hurt 1,200 people. So these middle-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they come near Earth.

source: Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges. Luckily, this kind of collapse is relatively infrequent, especially with modern bridges. Engineers have learned to design bridges in earthquake zones on areas that are much more resistant to movement.
candidate: Earthquakes (when the ground shakes) can damage buildings and bridges. But bridges do not fall down from earthquakes very often, especially new bridges. Engineers have learned how to build bridges in places with earthquakes. They choose ground that does not move much.

source: The Hunger Games are an annual event, which the Capitol uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling. Every year one boy and one girl aged 12 to 18 are chosen from each district by lottery to compete in a battle in which only one person can survive. The chosen teenagers are called "tributes". The whole nation is forced to watch the event on television.

These teenagers are called “tributes.” Everyone in the country must watch it on TV.

source: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are a common sight in many cities and towns. But in recent years, the world's press has been full of reports of wild animals coming into cities in bigger and bigger numbers. There have been bears in Vancouver parks, leopards on the streets of Mumbai and wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when bigger animals come into our cities? Are they welcome or are they considered a danger or a pest?

Do people welcome them, or do they think they are dangerous or a problem?

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.
candidate: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids (PHAs) are space rocks that can come very close to Earth, within about 7.5 million kilometres. NASA has made a map of about 1,400 of these PHAs, and none of them is expected to be a danger in the next 100 years. With today’s technology, NASA can watch these objects and predict if one might hit Earth. If needed, they could send up one of two defence missions.

source: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was flipping between channels on TV. It was at the time of the US invasion of Iraq. The only programmes she could find on TV were 'reality' programmes of young people competing to win a million dollars and news programmes about the war. Suzanne says that the two things start to merge together in a disturbing way and the idea for The Hunger Games came to her.

source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

It has won many prizes and has been translated into 41 languages. Martel’s father worked for the government. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: Dreams of a phone call from an old friend or the death of someone close, for example, are more likely to be the result of coincidence than prophecy. And, of course, we probably choose to forget all the times we dream about such events but they don't happen.

source: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. In some cases, this could happen because inferior-quality material was used in the construction, or because of a defect in a key piece of the bridge. In other cases, the bridge was designed only to support a certain amount of weight and no more.
candidate: Sometimes a bridge falls down, and we do not know why at first. Engineers find the reason after a careful check. It can happen because builders used poor-quality materials, or because there is a fault in an important part of the bridge. It can also happen because the bridge was made to carry only a certain weight, and it carried too much.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!
candidate: I used to work five days a week. After my parental leave, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I talked with my boss, and we agreed I would work only three days a week. This meant I would get less pay, because I am paid only for the days I work (= "pro-rata"). But I did not have less work. Now I do five days of work in only three days, and I get paid much less for it.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!
candidate: Before, I worked a normal five-day week. After I returned from parental leave, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After talking with my boss, we agreed to reduce my working week to three days. This also meant a big cut in my pay, because my pay is pro rata, which means I get paid less if I work fewer days. But since then I have noticed that my workload has not decreased at all. Now I am doing five days of work in three days, but I am getting paid much less for it.

source: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.
candidate: A lot of business today happens between people in different countries. Many people use English, but the way people speak and what they expect in business can be very different in each culture. If you do not know the customs of the people you work with, you can think bad things that are not true, not understand each other, and have problems talking. Here are three simple areas of business manners around the world. They can help you next time you work with someone from another culture.

If you do not understand the usual rules and habits of your business partners, you may make unfair judgments, have misunderstandings, and cause communication problems. Here are three basic areas of business etiquette around the world that can help you when you work with someone from a different culture.

source: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

Brains did not suddenly get bigger, but people became more complex and more intelligent. Did using language make their brains work better? Or did more complex brains make language?

source: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.
candidate:
In the last 10 years, many big supermarket chains made people angry. People say they did bad things. They threw away a lot of food. They paid their suppliers (= the farmers and companies who sell to them) too little. They used too much plastic in their packaging. This hurts the environment.

Now, supermarkets and food shops are starting to listen. Many customers are angry about the huge plastic waste from packaging. So some of the biggest UK supermarkets signed a pact (= a promise between companies) to change their packaging and use less plastic.

In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.
candidate: Many major supermarket chains have been criticised for various unethical actions over the past ten years. They have wasted tons of food, underpaid their suppliers, and added to excessive plastic waste from their packaging, which has affected the environment. However, supermarkets and grocers are starting to pay attention. In response to growing public criticism of the huge amount of plastic waste from packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have joined a pact that promises to change packaging and reduce plastic waste.

source: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.
candidate: Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl in Bangladesh. She saw a foreign child playing with one. Wasfia wanted to try, but she only watched, because many people in her country said girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now she is one of the few people in the world to climb seven very high mountains, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She was the first person to use a hula hoop on the top of each mountain. She did this to help women and girls in her country. Many people there tell them not to do sports. She wants them to feel strong and brave.

source: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.

The company should also spend more money on training, especially on how to talk and work well with other people, including people from other countries. source: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
candidate: In the past 200 years, new technology and better health care meant fewer children died. Because of this, the number of people in the world grew fast. Big families had many children, and many of them lived to be adults and had their own children. But in the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. Since then, around the world, women have fewer babies: from about six to about two.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: If we know about possible differences in what people expect and how they act, we can avoid misunderstandings. But it is very important to remember that fixed ideas about a culture are bad for building good business relationships. Our national culture can make us think and act in a certain way. But many other things are important too: the part of the country we come from, the groups we spend time with, our age and gender, the culture in our company, and our own life experiences. So we should remember these possible differences, but we should not use them to say that all people in one country are the same.

Therefore, this knowledge of potential differences should stay in the back of our minds, not be used to label individuals from an entire nation.

source: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.

He is in his late 60s, and he is still very good. I am not surprised. He tells important stories about us and our lives. When you listen to his album "Born in the USA", you can hear these stories. They are still important today, just like before.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

Researchers found a change in one gene that happened 200,000 to 100,000 years ago. It seems to be connected to speaking and to how our brain controls our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change in this way. It is too early to know how much genes affect language, but maybe we will find the answers in our DNA one day.

source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
candidate:
NASA, the U.S. space agency, is now trying to make a list of smaller asteroids. An asteroid is a big rock that moves in space. They want to find ones that are 140 metres wide or bigger.

We think there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. Until now, NASA has found about 8,000. That means about 17,000 are still not found.

In 2013, a 19‑metre asteroid exploded over the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. About 1,200 people were hurt. This shows that medium-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they come near Earth.

source: The Hunger Games are an annual event, which the Capitol uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling. source: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are a common sight in many cities and towns. Are they welcome or are they considered a danger or a pest?

Are they welcome, or do people think they are dangerous or a problem?

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.

If there is a risk, NASA could use one of two ways to protect Earth.

source: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was flipping between channels on TV. It was at the time of the US invasion of Iraq. The only programmes she could find on TV were 'reality' programmes of young people competing to win a million dollars and news programmes about the war. Suzanne says that the two things start to merge together in a disturbing way and the idea for The Hunger Games came to her.

She could only find two kinds of shows: reality shows where young people tried to win a million dollars, and news about the war.
These two things mixed in her mind. It felt strange and worrying.
Then she got the idea for her book The Hunger Games.

source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

The book is by a Canadian writer, Yann Martel. It is his third book. It was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold more than seven million copies around the world. It has won some prizes. It has been translated into 41 languages.

Yann Martel is the son of a diplomat. A diplomat is a person who works for their government in other countries. When he was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. In some cases, this could happen because inferior-quality material was used in the construction, or because of a defect in a key piece of the bridge. In other cases, the bridge was designed only to support a certain amount of weight and no more.

Sometimes weak or cheap materials were used to build the bridge, or an important part had a problem. Other times, the bridge was made to carry only a certain weight. If the weight is more than that, it can fall down.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!
candidate: Before, I worked five days a week. After my parental leave (time off to care for my children) ended, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I talked with my boss. We changed my job to three days a week. This also meant I would earn less money. I am paid “pro‑rata,” which means I get paid only for the days I work. But my work has not become less. Now I do five days of work in only three days, and I get paid much less.

source: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.
candidate:
Today, many businesses work with people in other countries. Many people use English to talk. But the way people do business and speak at work can be very different in each culture.

If you do not know their usual ways of doing things, you may judge them in the wrong way. You may misunderstand them. You may also have problems talking to them.

Here are three simple areas of business manners (polite rules) that are different around the world. They can help you the next time you work with someone from another culture.

Here are three basic areas of business manners that differ around the world. Knowing them can help you when you work with someone from another culture.

source: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

For example, they made cave paintings.
We do not know how this is linked to language.
Human brains did not suddenly get bigger.
But people became smarter and could do harder things.
Did using language help their brains grow?
Or did brains that had grown more help language to start?

source: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.
candidate:
Many big supermarkets have been criticized in the last ten years.
People said they did some wrong things.
They threw away a lot of food.
They paid too little money to the people who sell them goods.
They used too much plastic to wrap products, and this plastic hurt the environment.
Now, supermarkets are starting to listen.
Many customers are angry about plastic waste from wrapping.
Some of the biggest UK supermarkets have agreed to a plan to change how they wrap products and use less plastic.

Because more customers are complaining about the large amount of plastic waste from packaging, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have signed a promise to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

source: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.
candidate:
When she was a young girl in Bangladesh, Wasfia Nazreen saw a child from another country playing with a hula hoop. She wanted to try, but many people there said girls should not use hula hoops or ride bikes, so she only watched.

Now Wasfia is one of the very few people who have climbed the Seven Summits, the highest mountains on each continent, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to hula hoop on the top of each mountain. She does this to help women and girls in Bangladesh feel strong and brave, in a place where many people still say girls should not play sports.

She is also the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top. She did this to inspire and give confidence to women and girls in a country that often tells them not to play sports.

source: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. - Give staff new and interesting tasks to help them grow.

The company should also spend more money on training. This training should include social skills and how to talk with people from different cultures and countries.

These steps will make a positive workplace and help employees do their best work.

source: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.

We should offer more flexible working hours and allow employees to work from locations they choose. Managers should find different ways to challenge staff and give more praise and recognition for their work. We should also invest more in training, especially in social and intercultural communication. This will help create a positive workplace where employees can do their best.

source: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
candidate:
In the last 200 years, new technology and better health care saved many children’s lives. Fewer children died young. Because of this, the world’s population grew fast. Families were big. Many children lived to be adults and then had their own children.

In the 1960s, birth control (ways to stop a pregnancy) became easier to get. People could choose to have fewer babies. The average number of babies per woman around the world went down from about six to about two.

But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.

Since then, the average number of babies a woman has worldwide fell from about six to about two.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: People can expect different things and act in different ways. Knowing this can help us avoid problems when we talk. But we must remember that fixed ideas about a culture can hurt good work relationships. A country's culture can make us act and think in some ways. But other things are important too: the region we come from, the groups we belong to, our age and gender, the culture of our company, and our own life experiences. So we should keep these possible differences in mind, but we should not use them to say that everyone from one country is the same.

The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: Understanding that people may have different expectations and ways of acting can help us avoid misunderstandings. But it is very important to remember that fixed ideas about cultures can harm good business relationships. A country’s culture can influence how we think and behave. However, many other things also shape us: the region we are from, the groups we spend time with, our age and gender, the culture of our company, and our personal life experiences. So we should keep these possible differences in mind, but we should not use them to label everyone from one country.

source: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.

Many famous singers stop making big hits.
But Bruce Springsteen still makes new hit music.
He still plays to full stadiums.
He is almost 70 years old, and he is still at his best.
This does not surprise me.
He tells important stories about our lives.
If you listen to his song "Born in the U.S.A.", you can hear these stories.
They are still important today, just like before.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
candidate:
Scientists want to know how our genes affect the brain and language. A gene is a very small part inside our body. It carries information from parents to children.

Did a change in a gene give people the ability to speak? Researchers found one important change in a gene. This change happened a long time ago, between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. It seems to help with speaking and with how the brain controls the mouth and face.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change in this way.

We still do not know how much genes affect language. One day, we may find the answers in our DNA. DNA is the code inside our cells.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change in the same way. We still do not know how much genes shape language, but in the future we might find the answers in our DNA.

source: Julie Wong is a leading researcher in the field of Robotics and AI. She has been published extensively as author and co-author of over 50 papers in highly regarded, peer-reviewed journals. She frequently speaks at international conferences and was awarded the prestigious Royal Academy Simone Fielding fellowship in 2012. Julie lives with her family in a smart home she designed herself.

She has written more than 50 research papers. Some she wrote alone, and some with other scientists. Many of these papers are in important science magazines.

She often gives talks at big meetings in many countries.

In 2012, she won a famous award from the Royal Academy. It is called the Simone Fielding fellowship.

Julie lives with her family in a smart home. She designed it herself. A smart home uses technology to control things like lights and heat.

source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
candidate: Asteroids are big rocks in space. NASA is now trying to find and list smaller ones that are 140 metres wide or more. There may be about 25,000 of this size. So far, they have found about 8,000. About 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded in the sky over Chelyabinsk, a city in Russia. It hurt 1,200 people. So these medium-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they pass close to Earth.

source: The Hunger Games are an annual event, which the Capitol uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling. The whole nation is forced to watch the event on television.

source: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are a common sight in many cities and towns. Are they welcome or are they considered a danger or a pest?

Do people welcome them, or do they think they are dangerous or a problem?

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.
candidate: A "Potentially Hazardous Asteroid" (PHA) is a space rock that can pass close to Earth, within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth’s orbit. Orbit means the path Earth travels around the Sun. If there is a risk, they have two ways to try to stop it.

source: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was flipping between channels on TV. It was at the time of the US invasion of Iraq. The only programmes she could find on TV were 'reality' programmes of young people competing to win a million dollars and news programmes about the war. Suzanne says that the two things start to merge together in a disturbing way and the idea for The Hunger Games came to her.

Then she got the idea for The Hunger Games.

source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

The lifeboat is on the Pacific Ocean, a very big ocean. There is also a tiger in the boat. The tiger is very dangerous.

The writer is Yann Martel. He is from Canada. This is his third book. It came out in 2001. The book has sold more than seven million copies around the world. It has won many prizes. People can read it in 41 languages.

Martel is the son of a diplomat, a government worker who works in other countries. When he was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. In some cases, this could happen because inferior-quality material was used in the construction, or because of a defect in a key piece of the bridge. In other cases, the bridge was designed only to support a certain amount of weight and no more.

Another reason can be a problem in an important part. Also, some bridges are made to carry only a certain weight. If the weight is more than that, the bridge can break.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!
candidate: I used to work five days a week. After I returned from parental leave (time off work to care for my children), I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I talked with my boss. We agreed I will work three days a week. This also means I get less money, because I am paid only for the days I work. But I saw that I still have the same work to do. Now I do five days of work in only three days, but I am paid much less.

source: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.
candidate:
Today, many people do business with people in other countries. Many of them use English to talk. But small differences in how people speak and what they expect in business can be very different from culture to culture.

If we do not understand the rules and habits of the people we work with, we can have problems. We may think bad things about them when it is not fair. We may not understand each other. We may stop communicating well.

Here are three simple areas where business manners are different around the world. Learning about them can help you when you work with someone from a different culture.

If we do not understand the usual rules and customs of the people we work with, we can make unfair judgements, misunderstand each other, and have serious communication problems. Here are three basic areas where business manners and rules differ around the world. Knowing these can help you the next time you work with someone from a different culture.

Or did their brains grow first, and then language came?

source: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.
candidate:
In the last ten years, many big supermarkets got a lot of criticism. People said they did wrong things. They threw away a lot of food. They paid the people and farms who sell to them too little. They used too much plastic in their packaging, and this made a lot of plastic trash. This hurts the environment.

But now, supermarkets and food shops are starting to listen. Many customers are angry about plastic waste from packaging. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets agreed to a plan. They promise to change their packaging and use less plastic. They want to make less plastic waste.

Because many customers are angry about the large amount of plastic waste from packaging, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have agreed to a plan to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

source: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.
candidate:

Now Wasfia is one of the few people who have climbed the Seven Summits. These are the highest mountains on the seven continents. Continents are big parts of the world, like Asia and Africa. She climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro too. She is the first person to hula-hoop on the top of each mountain.

She does this to support and encourage women and girls in Bangladesh, where many people still say girls should not do sports.

candidate: From these results, we think Girox Foods should run the company in a way that cares more about people. We should offer more flexible working hours. We should also let workers choose where they work, for example at home or in another place. Managers should give staff new tasks that help them learn, and praise them often. They should say thank you and notice good work. We should spend more money on training, especially on how to talk to people and work with people from other cultures. This will help us make a happy, supportive place of work where people can do their best.

Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.

Managers should set good challenges for our staff, and give more praise and thanks for the work they do. We should also spend more on training and development, especially in social communication and in communication with people from different cultures. This will help create a positive workplace where employees can do their best work.

source: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
candidate: In the last 200 years, new technology and better health care meant more babies lived. Fewer children died. So the number of people in the world grew fast. Many families were big. Their children grew up and had more children. In the 1960s, birth control became easy to get in many countries. Birth control means ways to stop pregnancy. After this, women had fewer babies. The world average went from about six babies per woman to about two.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate:
It helps to know that people can have different ideas and ways of acting. This can stop problems when we talk to each other.
But it is very important to remember that simple ideas about a culture can be bad for good working relationships.
A country’s culture can change how we act and think. But many other things also matter: the area we come from, the groups we spend time with, our age and gender, the way our company works, and our own life experiences.
So we should think about these possible differences. But we should not use them to say that everyone in a country is the same.

The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.

But it is very important to remember that fixed ideas about cultures can harm good business relationships. The culture of a country can affect how we think and act, but many other things also shape us: the area we come from, the groups we spend time with, our age and gender, the way our company works, and our personal life experiences. So we should keep these possible differences in mind, but we should not use them to label people from a whole country.

source: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.

This does not surprise me. He sings simple, important stories about people’s lives. When you listen to “Born in the U.S.A.”, you can hear that these stories still matter today.

When you listen to Born in the USA, those stories matter just as much today as they did in the past.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
candidate:
Scientists have more questions about how our genes affect the brain and language.
Genes are small parts of our body that we get from our parents.
Did some genes change and help humans speak?
Scientists found a small change in one gene. It happened a long time ago, about 200,000 to 100,000 years ago.
This change seems connected to speaking and to how the brain moves the mouth and face.
Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change in this way.
We still do not know how much genes affect language.
Maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA. DNA is the special code inside every cell.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change in this way. We cannot yet say how much genes affect language, but in the future we might find the answers in our DNA.

source: Julie Wong is a leading researcher in the field of Robotics and AI. She has been published extensively as author and co-author of over 50 papers in highly regarded, peer-reviewed journals. source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
candidate: An asteroid is a big rock that moves in space. NASA is the space agency of the USA. Now NASA is trying to find and put on a list some smaller asteroids. These are 140 metres across or bigger. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size. So far, about 8,000 are on the list. That means about 17,000 are not found yet. In 2013, a 19‑metre asteroid exploded in the sky above a city in Russia called Chelyabinsk. About 1,200 people were hurt. So asteroids of this size can be very dangerous if they come into the space around Earth.

source: Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges. Luckily, this kind of collapse is relatively infrequent, especially with modern bridges. Engineers have learned to design bridges in earthquake zones on areas that are much more resistant to movement.

source: The Hunger Games are an annual event, which the Capitol uses to remind the districts that they are being punished for rebelling. Every year one boy and one girl aged 12 to 18 are chosen from each district by lottery to compete in a battle in which only one person can survive. The chosen teenagers are called "tributes". The whole nation is forced to watch the event on television.

The chosen teenagers are called “tributes”. Everyone in the country must watch the Games on TV.

source: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are a common sight in many cities and towns. But in recent years, the world's press has been full of reports of wild animals coming into cities in bigger and bigger numbers. There have been bears in Vancouver parks, leopards on the streets of Mumbai and wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when bigger animals come into our cities? Are they welcome or are they considered a danger or a pest?
candidate: We often see small animals in cities and towns. We see birds, squirrels, mice, and insects. These days, we see many news stories about more and more wild animals coming into cities. Wild animals are animals that live in nature, not with people. There were bears in parks in Vancouver, leopards on the streets of Mumbai, and wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when big animals come into our cities? Do people welcome them, or do people think they are dangerous or a problem?

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.
candidate: An asteroid is a big rock in space. “Potentially Hazardous Asteroids” are asteroids that can come very close to Earth. They can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of the path that Earth takes around the Sun. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. None of them are a danger in the next 100 years. With today’s technology, NASA can watch these rocks and tell if one might hit Earth. If that happens, they could use two kinds of defence.

source: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was flipping between channels on TV. It was at the time of the US invasion of Iraq. The only programmes she could find on TV were 'reality' programmes of young people competing to win a million dollars and news programmes about the war. Suzanne says that the two things start to merge together in a disturbing way and the idea for The Hunger Games came to her.

One kind was “reality” shows: real people play games and try to win a lot of money, like one million dollars. The other kind was news about the war. Suzanne says these two things mixed together in her mind, and it felt strange and worrying. Then she got the idea for her book, The Hunger Games.

source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.
candidate:
“Life of Pi” is a book. It tells a very unusual story. It is about Pi, a teenage boy from India. His ship sinks. He is on a small lifeboat, and he cannot leave it. A lifeboat is a small boat people use when a ship sinks. He is in the Pacific Ocean. This is a very big ocean. There is a very dangerous tiger in the boat with him.

The writer is Yann Martel. He is from Canada. This was his third book. It was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold more than seven million copies around the world. It has won many prizes. People have translated it into 41 languages.

Martel is the son of a diplomat. A diplomat is a person who works for the government in other countries. When he was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: Dreams of a phone call from an old friend or the death of someone close, for example, are more likely to be the result of coincidence than prophecy. And, of course, we probably choose to forget all the times we dream about such events but they don't happen.

source: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. In some cases, this could happen because inferior-quality material was used in the construction, or because of a defect in a key piece of the bridge. In other cases, the bridge was designed only to support a certain amount of weight and no more.

Or an important part of the bridge had a problem. In other cases, the bridge was made to hold only a certain amount of weight. Not more.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!
candidate: I used to work five days a week. After I came back from parental leave (time away from work to care for a baby), I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I talked to my boss. We agreed I would work three days a week. This means I get less money because I work fewer days. But I do not have less work. Now I do five days of work in only three days, and I get paid much less.

source: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.
candidate: Today, many businesses work with people in other countries. Many people use English, but the way people do business is not the same in every country. There are small differences in how people speak and write, and in what they expect. If we do not understand the normal ways of people from another culture, we can think about them in an unfair way. We can also misunderstand each other and stop communicating well. Here are three simple points about business manners in different countries. They can help you when you work with someone from another culture.

Here are three basic areas of business etiquette around the world that can help you when you next work with someone from a different culture.

source: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

Brains did not suddenly get bigger, but life became more complicated, and people became more clever. Did using language make their brains grow? Or did more complicated brains make language?

source: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.
candidate:
In the last ten years, many big supermarkets and food shops got a lot of complaints. People said they did some bad things. They wasted a lot of food. They paid too little to the people who sell to them (farmers and other sellers). They used too much plastic in the packaging (the plastic around products). This plastic hurts the environment.

Now, supermarkets are starting to listen. Many customers are angry about all the plastic waste and complain. Because of this, some of the biggest supermarkets in the United Kingdom (UK) signed an agreement. They promise to change how they pack products and to use less plastic.

But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.

They have wasted tonnes of food, underpaid their suppliers, and added to too much plastic waste in their packaging, which has harmed the environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to pay attention. Because of growing consumer pressure about the huge amount of plastic waste from packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed a pact promising to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

source: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.
candidate: When she was a young girl in Bangladesh, Wasfia Nazreen saw a child from another country playing with a hula hoop. She only watched, because in her country people said girls should not use hula hoops or ride bikes. Now very few people in the world have climbed the Seven Summits, seven very high mountains, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. Wasfia is one of them, and she is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top. She does this to help women and girls in her country feel strong. In her country, many people still say they should not do sport.

Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.

She does this to empower women and girls in a country that discourages them from playing sports.

source: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.

They should praise good work and say thank you more often. We should spend more money on training, especially on how to talk and work well with people from different cultures. This will help make a happy place to work, so people can do their best work.

source: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
candidate: In the last 200 years, medicine and health care got better. Fewer children died when they were young. So the number of people in the world grew fast. Families were big. Many children lived to be adults. They then had their own children. In the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. Birth control means ways to stop having a baby. After that, the average number of babies each woman had in the world went down, from about six to about two.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate:
People from different places can expect different things and act in different ways. If we know this, we can avoid miscommunication (not understanding each other). But we must also remember: cultural stereotypes are bad. A stereotype is a simple idea about a whole group. It can hurt good business relationships.

How we think and act is not only from our country. It also comes from the part of the country we come from, the groups we are in, our age and gender, the way our company works, and our own life experiences.

So, it is good to know about possible differences. Keep this in mind, but do not judge people or put them in a box because of their country.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: Being more aware of possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid communication problems. But we must also remember that cultural stereotypes can harm good business relationships. National culture can shape how we think and act, but many other things influence us too: the region we come from, the communities we belong to, our age and gender, our corporate culture, and our personal experiences. So we should keep these possible differences in mind, but we should not use them to label everyone in a country in the same way.

source: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.
candidate:
Springsteen is a famous musician. Many famous singers stop making new music that many people like. But Springsteen is different. He still makes new music. His new songs are very popular. He plays big concerts in stadiums. Many people go to hear him. He is still very good. He is in his late 60s (about 68 or 69 years old).

I am not surprised. He tells us very important stories about our lives. "Born in the USA" is the name of one of his famous songs. When you listen to it, you can hear that his stories are still important today.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
candidate:
Scientists want to know how genes affect our brain and language. A gene is a small piece of information in our body. We get genes from our parents. Sometimes a gene changes. This change is called a mutation.

Scientists ask: Did a gene change help humans use language?

They found one gene that changed about 200,000 to 100,000 years ago. This change seems to be connected to speaking and to how our brain moves our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change like this.

We still do not know how much genes help with language. Maybe, in the future, we will find the answers in our DNA. DNA is the long code inside our body.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not change in this way. It is still too early to know how much genes influence language, but one day we may find the answers in our DNA.

source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.

source: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are a common sight in many cities and towns. Are they welcome or are they considered a danger or a pest?

Or are they dangerous? People don’t know if they are welcome or not.

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. source: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was flipping between channels on TV. It was at the time of the US invasion of Iraq. source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

It has also won prizes and has been translated into many languages, like 41. Yann Martel lived in different countries when he was a child, such as Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!

But now, I do the same work as before, but I work less days and I earn less money!

source: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.

Here are three important things to remember when you work with someone from a different country.

source: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.

But now, the shops are starting to listen. Many big shops in the UK are making a promise. They want to change how they pack things and use less plastic. People are angry about the plastic, so the shops want to help the environment.

source: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.

source: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: Sometimes, we need to think about how people might do things differently. This can help us avoid mistakes when we talk. But it's also important to remember that ideas about different countries can be bad. Countries are different, and people are different too. We are also affected by where we live, our friends, how old we are, if we are a man or a woman, our work place, and our own experiences. So, we should remember these things, but not to think that everyone from a country is the same.

The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
candidate: It’s helpful to know that people might have different ideas about what’s expected of them and how they behave. This can help us avoid misunderstandings. However, it’s important to remember that ideas about different cultures can be harmful when building good business relationships. While where someone comes from – their country, their community, and their age and gender – can influence how they think and act, so can the company they work for and their own experiences. It’s good to be aware of these potential differences, but we shouldn’t use them to judge individuals based on their nationality.

source: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

source: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.

source: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. source: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

When he was a child, he lived in different countries like Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

source: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school.
